conversations.content: The World's Tastiest Dish: Part One
One day, Nimis tried to figure out the tastiest thing in the whole world. Could any food top the pancakes he always ate? He needed to know!
So, leaving a note behind, he set off.  ＂I go search for treats. No need to come looking.                           - Nimis.＂
First, he stumbled on a big, fancy restaurant. The sign said L'Amandier, and he recognized the chef's face. It was time to hurry in!
All manner of hors d'oeuvres! Piles of perfectly cooked steak! And all the other fine courses one would expect besides! He immediately wolfed it down.
...Blech! Gross! Nimis no like! No need for seconds here!  Er, right. Clearly it was time to head for greener pastures.
Next, he went to a town with the aroma of spices filling the air. The chefs cooked a world of exotic curries for him, but they couldn't beat his favorite fluffy pancakes.
He sampled many dishes from across the world—from the dried-meat soup of a snowy nation to the juiciest pork buns in Taiwu—and many a fine meal did he have.
But nowhere on the continent did he find a dish as good as his pancakes—which meant it was time to travel across the seas!
After being bounced up and down on the waves, he landed in the island nation of Hinomoto. There, he found a nice little restaurant called Nanakusa.
＂Would sir like some tempura?＂ ＂Chawanmushi?＂ ＂Suimono?＂ ＂Perhaps a rice ball?＂ ...And his verdict?
SO TASTY! NIMIS LOVE!
He ate everything on the menu. Then he ate the menu. It was just that good.
If anywhere was going to have a dish that beat those pancakes, it might be here! Filled with hope, Nimis awaited the restaurant's final signature dish...
The World's Tastiest Dish: Part Two
The glutton Nimis was traveling the world in search of its tastiest meal. His journey took him across the sea to the famous Nanakusa restaurant, where he awaited a final dish...
...But it was sold out.
Nimis could barely contain his shock, and left the restaurant deeply disappointed.
He'd come so far and eaten so much, but still he couldn't find anything that compared to his favorite fluffy pancakes.
Disappointed, he returned home, only for a familiar voice to call out to him:  ＂Hey, Nimis. You hungry?＂
The silver-haired chef's food was always good, so he couldn't say no.  But as he ate, he found it still wasn't as tasty as his favorite pancakes.
What was going on? Had he lost the ability to appreciate good food somehow? The thought made him start to cry bitter, salty tears.
＂Ingredients and method aren't all that determines how good food is,＂ said the chef kindly. ＂Sometimes a memory matters even more.＂
...A memory?
He always had his pancakes back at the castle, where he enjoyed them with all his friends. The taste and the company satisfied both his heart and his stomach.
＂Go,＂ said the chef. ＂Go now and find your favorite food.＂
Nimis didn't need telling twice! He ran as fast as his legs would carry him, because now he knew just what his tastiest food in the world was.
＂Oh! Welcome back, Nimis. We've been worried about you. What would you like to eat?＂
＂FLUFFY PANCAAAAAKES!＂
